thread.title: Regional Fed banks backed holding discount rate steady - minutes

title: Regional Fed banks backed holding discount rate steady - minutes

organizations.name: board of governors of the federal reserve system

text:
May 29, 2018 / 6:11 PM / Updated an hour ago Regional Fed banks backed holding discount rate steady - minutes Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - All 12 regional Federal Reserve banks supported holding steady the interest rate commercial banks pay for emergency loans ahead of the central bankâ€™s latest policy meeting, minutes of Fed discount rate discussions showed on Tuesday. FILE PHOTO: The seal for the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System is on display in Washington, DC, U.S., June 14, 2017. REUTERS/Joshua Roberts/File Photo
The U.S. central bank held the discount rate at 2-1/4 percent while also holding steady its benchmark lending rate at its May 1-2 meeting.
The Fed last raised interest rates on March 21 and is expected to lift them again in June. Reporting by Jason Lange; Editing by Andrea Ricci
